reviews.text: Such a beautiful place! The view is just like a fairy tail world. The cute houses with grey blue roof, the river carries the romantic atmosphere. In spring all the flowers are blooming, which bring bright colors to this place. Love it!

I really recommend visiting the Casemates because it's a very nice experience. The panoramic views are amazing. The tunnels are illuminated and very easy to use. It's safe also for visiting with kids. They don't give you a map for the trajectory so the whole visit it's entartained by the fact that you have to understand how to find the exit. I enjoyed it very much!

I would love to give this place the full five stars that it deserves, but it is under construction, so if someone is planning a trip mainly to see this attraction they should consider this.

A good deal of the structure is not accessible because of the renovations. There is no parking nearby, so keep that in mind especially if the weather is wet! Also, not the best spot for people with mobility issues… a lot of stairs to climb.

This site offers amazing views, a must see when in Luxembourg City. The casemates aren't open all the time, but there's plenty to see even when closed. The river valley is beautiful with flowering trees, an open vista and the classic architecture. It's also an easy walk from the city center.

A great way to walk in the history of this beautiful city. You can get wonderful views from the Casemates of Luxembourg City. There could be clearer signage for easier navigation. Definitely take one of the info leaflets to help you get around!

Such a beautiful place! The view is just like a fairy tail world. The cute houses with grey blue roof, the river carries the romantic atmosphere. In spring all the flowers are blooming, which bring bright colors to this place. Love it!

I really recommend visiting the Casemates because it's a very nice experience. The panoramic views are amazing. The tunnels are illuminated and very easy to use. It's safe also for visiting with kids. They don't give you a map for the trajectory so the whole visit it's entartained by the fact that you have to understand how to find the exit. I enjoyed it very much!

I would love to give this place the full five stars that it deserves, but it is under construction, so if someone is planning a trip mainly to see this attraction they should consider this.

A good deal of the structure is not accessible because of the renovations. There is no parking nearby, so keep that in mind especially if the weather is wet! Also, not the best spot for people with mobility issues… a lot of stairs to climb.

This site offers amazing views, a must see when in Luxembourg City. The casemates aren't open all the time, but there's plenty to see even when closed. The river valley is beautiful with flowering trees, an open vista and the classic architecture. It's also an easy walk from the city center.

A great way to walk in the history of this beautiful city. You can get wonderful views from the Casemates of Luxembourg City. There could be clearer signage for easier navigation. Definitely take one of the info leaflets to help you get around!
It's a very impressive place. A good area to walk around. Near there is a great view of the city.

Luxembourg as is mix of Gothic and Baroque architecture and you would many building in the similar lines. Really nothing great to see Place that too alone from outside . its under maintenance till Mid Nov. Also Guard of honour is  so simple that can not hold you. Square is good for some photos.
Lovely looking building but you are unable to go inside unless they are on their summer holidays. That's a few weeks July/August time.

I got a tour of the palace in English.  Unfortunately they don't allow any photos inside.  The guide provides a lot of detail regarding the history of the lineage and of various paintings and objects inside.  It is pretty dry unless you are into the history of Luxembourg.  I brought my young kids with me and they certainly we're extremely bored.  It is about an hour long.
nothing spectacular. combines nicely with a walk around the cathedral and Gelle Frä
This place is full of history - VERY cool visit. Make sure you are ok with walking up and down step stairs ...
Such a cool walk through the old fortress caves !
History worth learning!
Very nice place.  Really enjoyed visiting this historical site.
A magnificent place especially if you go over the bridge. A nice view of the city.
This cemetery is so sad, but immaculately preserved. A great tribute to  the soldiers of  the battle of the bulge.
Nice quite place away from the crowds. Will mean more to Americans than other nationalists.
Very impressive and dignified place. I recommend visiting and remembering what they were fighting for.

My husband and I were stationed in Germany in the 80's and visited this cemetery several times. When my parents came to visit us we brought them here. It was especially meaningful for my father as he served under General Patton during world war two. It is such a beautiful place and a peaceful resting place for our soldiers who paid the ultimate price.
A quiet and moving place with great info on World War II.

it was a good place to go for having a big meal with reasonable price. 
The dish is  pretty big so you can share 2 dishes with 3 female friends. 
The restaurant is located near the main train station. It took 5 min on foot for me.
Average restaurant with a good variety of food and in addition a separate daily menu. Portions are quite big, so you will not leave hungry. Prices are okay.

The worse customer service we have ever experienced in any place. Did not feel welcome at all, feel sorry that i even entered in the first place, and obviously did not stay. Luckily there are other nice restaurants near by. Absolutely terrible.

A WONDERFUL SERVICE ! INTERNATIONAL MENU IN FRENCH ENGLISH AND ITLAIAN MANY CHOICE TOO, VERY GOOD PRICE ! NEAR THE CENTER OF LUXEMBOURG WHEN THE WEATHER IS NICE YOUCAN EAT OUTSIDE MANY PLACES IF YOU COME WITH A GROUP OF PERSON 
IT WAS A GREAT SOUVENIR I WENT 2 TIMES  !

Never have I ever experienced such racism and rudeness until tonight at dinner at this restaurant in Luxembourg.

After finding out that the restaurant we enjoyed during our last trip was closed for the summer (Chez Rafael is a great choice!), we decided to simply dine at an outdoor restaurant across the street, not realizing how rudely I will be treated in about 10 minutes’ time, not only as a paying customer, but as a human being.

I grew up in the U.S. as an Asian American but I never experienced such racial profiling, simple ignorance, rudeness, and aggression from anybody. The restaurant owner told us to move tables from the initial table where we were seated because it was “reserved for drinks only,” but a few minutes later, other white Europeans sat there and enjoyed their meal right at that table. We waited about 15 minutes until we can finally get the restaurant owner to come over to take our order. Before we were even finished with ordering (while we were still looking at the menu and pointing at the item to ask what this local Luxembourg dish is), he decided to just walk away. Several times during the meal, we were sure they heard us, but they all simply ignored us and didn’t even look our way. My other colleague was joining later after her conference call, so we asked for another menu and an extra plate, the owner of the restaurant glared at us and shouted, “why you want another menu? For what?” I was astonished at the type of racism that I faced this evening. I lost all of my appetite and had to leave early because I just couldn’t stand this mistreatment as a paying customer.

I really hope that this is not a representation of racism against Asians in Luxembourg. I am baffled at what I went through this evening.

They Lie to me NO Vegan Option & Waiting  There for Nothing waste of time at the Table. I Did NOT Like What Was on The Menu & it was Disgusting. So I left quick. I Did not want to be Seen There Either. Because I'm kinda famous. Definitely Not My Type Of Place.

I am vegan and one of my friends who went with me eats halal (my friend enjoyed the lamb). We loved the food and the experience so much that we came back the next night also. The staff and owners are very nice. Next time I am back in Albuquerque I will eat here again.

My favorite Indian food lunch buffet here in Albuquerque.  We make it a point to go meet at least once a month with our friends.  They have all the great stuff you'd expect at a Indian food buffet and they do a great job at all of it.  It's typically bustling and busy at lunch, but with several dining areas and attentive polite staff that are constantly on top of everything, it's always a pleasurable experience.

First time coming here, and first time eating Indian food, and I have to say that I loved it! The location is pretty old and might be in need for an update, but they make up for it with the great food. I went for lunch, and they have their buffet, which makes it really easy to get a sample of their offerings
Always wonderful!  Have been a patron for years, and it's always a good bet.  Had the baked eggplant and lamb meatballs.....great!  Always have an appetizer.

The kniddelen mat speck kachkeis was phenomenal! It's basically dumplings with bacon in a cheese sauce. Very filling and delicious. Every thing looked amazing and smelled fantastic. The staff was very helpful with our limited French skills.

A great glimpse into traditional Luxembourgish dishes. Had the pig's leg and it was delicious, though it's a huge portion! You'd probably want to share that with someone. Nonetheless it was delicious. They also serve Causel, a beer made by a  Luxembourgish microbrewery. Definitely a goer with a meal like this.
Food is awesome and very Luxembourgish! Best food we had here and the service is perfect. Great beer and great atmosphere!

Came to this place looking for some authentic Luxembourgan food and it was a complete let down. My wife went in first with our kids while I parked my car. It was not until 20 minutes later when somebody finally acknoledged them and brought them the menus, even though we had a reservation. The person that sat them only pointed to the table from afar. They don't have any options for kids, and the only dish maybe considered for children (fish and chips) was no longer available after we ordered it. We left with our drinks at hand and empty bellies. It's like they did not want us there. Horrible experience.
First time I rate with a single star. The waiter did not treat us with respect. I did not understand the reason. I hope not a racist one.

Nourriture bonne et bio. 
L'endroit est un peu bruyant.

Top class and luxury Hotel in Luxembourg. I will rate this as the best luxury hotel in the country. Meets the high standard set by Sofitel brand! Centrally located in the heart of Luxembourg city. Great restaurant, amazing breakfast and the top floor bar offers an amazing view of Luxembourg city!! GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

The location of the hotel is OK, but not great, its still a 15 minute walk to the city center. Staff are excellent. 
The room was OK, the windows don't open and the AC didn't really work, hence the room got stuffy and hot quickly, even though I was on my own (worse with two people in a room). My travel company all experienced the same (3 rooms across different floors). 
Breakfast is excellent and the view from the restaurant and bar is amazing.

Excellent service. Forgot phone in the car it was braught to the room. We were given great information about the different aspects of Luxembourg from the staff. All accommodation was made for our baby. Great view.
This is worth the stars. We had a great breakfast event. Good support from the staff, nice view from the top bar.

Excellent rooms, but a bit too small for a 5 star hotel. Just a shower not a bathtub in the room's. Free Minibar. Nice cocktail bar with a great view. Hotel parking not accessible from hotel directly.

Empire, a name that makes me salivate for their Chicken Kebab, which is also their specialty. It's absolutely delectable and a must-try item at Empire. This restaurant is famous for serving Arabian and Malabar cuisines but they also have Chinese and North Indian food in their menu. Empire is popular for their non-vegetarian food.
We ordered Chicken Kebab and Grilled Chicken in the starters. I was surprised to see that the portions were large and sufficient enough for two people. In fact, we had no appetite left for the main course after having this much. Grilled Chicken was not very impressive to me but the Kebab was really very tasty.
The ambience is nice with beautiful decor and bright lighting. The service is excellent and the staff is polite and courteous.

Been here a few times when traveling for work. One of the best places at this price range. 

Very comfy, clean rooms that are reasonably spacious and a great location. Well trained and professional housekeeping staff.

Hoping that they maintain this for long.

This was my second time stay with empire Koramangala.

Good food, friendly room service staff and receptionists. 

Overall it was a great stay but they charged me Rs. 700 extra inspite of early check in inclusion in my trip details... 

Overall good stay but won't prefer the same next time.. Thank you.

Tasty food. Excellent service. Good hygiene. If u are planning for a treat with your family or friends this is fine. We have excellent complement offers and this is the superb restaurant in Koramangala where u ll find find everything under one roof

It's a good one. But starter quantity are less compared to price. Taste good most of it. Buy briyani by plates rather than combo. Prawn, fish or mutton. Squid fry tasted good.  Do not order pitcher it's waste of money. Better buy individual glass of drinks like lemonade or soda

Top class and luxury Hotel in Luxembourg. I will rate this as the best luxury hotel in the country. Meets the high standard set by Sofitel brand! Centrally located in the heart of Luxembourg city. Great restaurant, amazing breakfast and the top floor bar offers an amazing view of Luxembourg city!! GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

The room was OK, the windows don't open and the AC didn't really work, hence the room got stuffy and hot quickly, even though I was on my own (worse with two people in a room). My travel company all experienced the same (3 rooms across different floors). 
Breakfast is excellent and the view from the restaurant and bar is amazing.

Excellent service. Forgot phone in the car it was braught to the room. We were given great information about the different aspects of Luxembourg from the staff. All accommodation was made for our baby. Great view.
This is worth the stars. We had a great breakfast event. Good support from the staff, nice view from the top bar.

Excellent rooms, but a bit too small for a 5 star hotel. Just a shower not a bathtub in the room's. Free Minibar. Nice cocktail bar with a great view. Hotel parking not accessible from hotel directly.
